<JD_START>
Job Title: Maintenance Supervisor

Location: Lake Forest, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Production, Project Management

Description:
This key position is responsible for the operation of all warehouse equipment, machinery and maintenance personnel. The individual will ensure safe and efficient operation of all equipment, perform scheduled preventative maintenance as planned; perform production equipment changeovers; troubleshoot hydraulic, pneumatic, electrical and mechanical problems when needed; maintain proper records for maintenance, inventory of parts and emergency repairs; ensure good housekeeping habits related to maintenance; train on equipment, and share ideas and other problems with the team.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONIBIILITIES:Develop staff for future opportunities by providing constructive feedback and writing and conducting performance reviewsDevelop training materials and procedures for departmentCollaborate with Operations teams to provide the level of service neededWork with vendors and suppliers for preventative maintenance, troubleshooting and new equipment installation when applicableEnsure production and warehouse equipment are running safely and efficientlyImpacts retention by fostering a respectful team environment that supports workplace values through professional communication and timely problem solvingDevelop plans with action items to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the departmentManage daily activities of the maintenance team to ensure adequate overage while meeting budgetary goalsCoordinate with Quality Assurance to ensure SQF requirements are bring met for machinery and equipmentMaintain department facility, training and regulatory logs and reportsAssist in interviewing candidates as assignedCommunicate effectively with outside and inside partners at all levels of the organizationAssists in maintaining the security of the facilityMaintain reasonable and reliable attendanceMinimal Travel as requiredOther duties/projects as assigned
EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCETechnical maintenance skill training in mechanized, electronic and/or automated technologyMinimum of 10 years supervisory experience in a similar environmentMinimum of 5 years CMMS experienceExperience with pneumatics, electrical and hydraulicsAbility to review and interpret technical drawingsCertifications in mechanized, electronic and automated technology preferredKnowledge of Microsoft OfficeSKILLSAbility to read, write and speak English effectivelyAbility to review and interpret technical drawings and use diagnostic tools for troubleshootingPHYSICAL DEMAND AND WORK EFFORTAbility to work in cold storage environment (-10° to 40°)Lift up to 30lbs continuously and 50lbs on occasionWalk and stand for entire shift (8-10 hours) and stoop, kneel, crawl and climbAble to work in heights of 30+ feet

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
